intro: Aquilegia corniculata, commonly known as the horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, spurred petals that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms in the spring. Aquilegia corniculata is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy and often colorful flowers.
